column1: Increasing the humidity (moisture) in your home helps eliminate the dry air that can irritate and inflame the airways in your nose and throat.
Using a humidifier in the home can help relieve a stuffy nose and can help break up mucus so you can cough it up.
The following are some general tips: - Always use a cool-mist humidifier (vaporizer), especially for children.
This can cause breathing problems in some people.
